compRecruitScreeningAnswers.The reason why you want to come to Japan: I want to come to Japan because Japan is one of the leading countries in AI and I am deeply interested in the field od AI. I have always been fascinated by the amazing work culture of Japan and I myself want to be a part of that work culture.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.The career plan you want: Currently I am in the 3rd year of my college and will graduate after almost 1.5 years. After that I plan to do a stable job preferably in the field of AI/ML and backend development.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.In which country do you want to work aft: For me, there is no such boundation. I can work in India, the US and even Japan.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Are you likely to be adaptable to other: Although I am quite attached to my Indian roots, I am confident enough that given a sufficient amount of time in a new place, I will be able to adapt to the culture well.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Instead of English-speaking countries li: Apart from the amazing work culture and the hard-working people in Japan with whom I want to work, I will get to learn a new language while I work in Japan.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.What are your expectations from the comp: I want to get a decent package enough to stay comfortably in a foreign country like Japan. Furthermore, I want to work on projects related to my chosen field of interest.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.What would you like to accomplish during: I want to contribute to cutting-edge AI/ML technologies by applying by technical skills whilst also getting to learn new skills.

compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Your strengths and characteristics: I am a hard-worker. I am good at grasping new concepts. I work good with a team.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Weaknesses or areas where they would lik: It takes time for me to acquire new skills. Also, I prefer not to work alone.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Steps they are taking or plan to take to: I try to work alone to learn to work alone.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Example of a challenge or setback you ha: During a tight project deadline, our team encountered unexpected technical issues that threatened the completion of the entire project.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Lessons learned from that experience: We quickly adopted a collaborative problem-solving approach, fostering open communication. We learned the importance of adaptability and contingency planning, ensuring smoother project execution in the future.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Do you have any unique background that d: My background in both engineering and graphic design sets me apart, allowing me to bridge the gap between technical and creative aspects in projects.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Do you have any specialty?: Specializing in data analytics, I excel in deriving meaningful insights from complex datasets, providing valuable information for strategic decision-making.

projects.title: LLMGuard
projects.description: Developed pipeline for bias/toxicity detection in outputs of large language models and integrated GPT-2, BERT and other language models for testing. Developed user-friendly UI (ReactJS) and backend (Django Rest Framework) for integration of detectors and providing an intuitive platform for using the developed pipeline.

projects.title: Literature Society IITJ Website
projects.description:
A website developed for managing various activities for literature society of IIT Jodhpur. The website contains the following features: 
-User Profile Management (with in site notification service) 
-Library Management System 
-Feature to upload written works to be displayed on website (Reader's Section). 
-Moderator and Admin access profiles to approve books and contents.

projects.title: CloudPhysician's Vital Extraction Challenge
projects.description: Fine-tuned DETR and detectron to for ICU monitor segmentation images of ICU rooms and vital segmentation from ICU monitors. Worked on graph digitisation algorithm to digitize ECG strip

projects.title: Multi Model Data Analysis for Annotation of Human Activities
projects.description: Performed data analysis and outlier detection on a dataset of accelerometer and gyroscope readings. Ideated and executed a pipeline for performing cleaning and detecting the activity type throught the dataset.

projects.title: FaceNet Implementation
projects.description: Implemented FaceNet research paper and Standard Siamese network from scratch using PyTorch. Successfully trained both on CelebA dataset.

projects.title: SHAMIYANA APP
projects.description:
A Food Delivery cum ordering App for Shamiyana Cafe. 
Objectives 
- To make the ordering process hassle-free and time-saving. 
- To manage the Cafe easily by a web portal. 
Deliverables 
- An App for Shamiyana Cafe where customers can orderfood online.

projects.title: RAPID
projects.description: A web app where users can play games like chess with their friends, while having a one to one video call with them to increase the engagement. Uses WebSockets forrealtime communication of gameplay information. Uses WebRTC api forthe video call feature.

projects.title: SMART SENSING MIDDLEWARE
projects.description: A web application to show data collected from smart home devices and display it in the form of graphs for better understanding and use in the analysis.

projects.title: Cloudphysician's Vital Extraction Challenge
projects.description: Extracted the values of vitals from the images of ICU monitors and returned the values in form of a python dictionary. We used object detection to identify the relevant areas from the image and then applied text recognition.

projects.title: Multi Model Data Analysis for Annotation of Human Activities
projects.description: A pipeline which can predict human activities based on continuous analysis of data provided by accelerometer and gyroscope present in a smartwatch.

projects.title: Website for the Literature Society of the college
projects.description: A website comprising of a complete library management system along with a readers' section where users can view uploaded content and choose to upload their content too. These are the two major features among many others.

projects.title: Post-processing of Large Language Models
projects.description: We had to build a user interface for machine learning models that we trained to detect hate profanity, bias etc in the responses generated by large language models. I worked on developing the backend of the system, i.e, on integrating the machine learning models with the user interface using Rest APIs.
